SEC. 101. Extension of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through March 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for carrying out such activities during the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Amendments are made to certain sections of the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2004. Amendments are made to certain sections of the Social Security Act for fiscal year 2004, including changes to the contingency fund and maintenance of effort requirements. Extension of the national random sample study of child welfare and child welfare waiver authority is extended through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations from the Treasury. Grants and payments can be made for activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for in 2002. TITLE II--TAX PROVISIONS

SEC. 201. Amends section 6103(l)(13) of the Internal Revenue Code to extend disclosure of return information for student loan repayment until December 31, 2004.
